For this series of "public dress rehearsals** by the Little Orchestra Society, David
Randolph provides "live** program notes-. He gives brief preliminary talks, together with
demonstrations of themes by the orchestra,, in a manner similar to that employed in his
Mbsig for the Connoisseur programs which were at one time distriouted By the NAEB Network,
Of the Little Orchestra Society, the New Yorker magazine says? "They give us just
about the least orthodox and most wisely selected programs of any orchestral society
in town* **
By agreement with the American Guild of Radio Artists, the LOS Concerts may be played
by NAEB Network stations through Sept,, 30 They cannot be played after Sept* 30*
T^g 1,03 Concert3 ore of varying length, but those which run short of 1*55*00 have been
"filled out** by a second program,, The Randolph Singer^* which features choral music
by the .group directed by David Randolph,
